early.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: in the first part of a period of time, event, or process
early.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: In the early days, the railways mainly carried goods.
She is in her early twenties.
The money could be paid as early as next week.
He spent the early part of  his career at St John’s Hospital.
My earliest memories are of fruit trees.
early.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: arriving or happening before the usual or expected time
early.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: David decided to take early retirement (=stop working before the normal age).
She drank herself into an early grave (=died younger than is normal).
The bus was ten minutes early.
I was a few minutes early for my appointment.
early.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: used to emphasize that something has just begun, especially when you do not know how it will develop
early.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: It’s too early to say what will happen.
It’s early days yet. I don’t want to make any predictions.
early.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: being one of the first people, events, machines etc
early.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Early motor cars had very poor brakes.
early.translation[0].note_box[0].section: early morning/afternoon/evening
The lake looked beautiful in the pale early morning light.
early spring/summer etc
These plants produce flowers from early spring to late summer.
early August/January etc
Italy is lovely in early June, before it gets too hot.
the early days/months/years of something
In the early years of our marriage, we lived with my wife’s parents.
in your early twenties/forties etc
Both men are in their early twenties.
the early 1920s/1970s etc
He lived in London in the early 1980s.
somebody’s early childhood/adolescence/life
We’ve known each other since early childhood.
an early stage
Patients can be treated with drugs, especially at the early stage of the disease.
the early part of something
I was doing quite well in the early part of the race.
somebody’s earliest memory
One of my earliest memories is of being at a busy railway station, trying to find my mum.
early.translation[0].note_box[1].section: early
arriving or happening before the usual or expected time
For once, the train arrived early.
Let’s have an early lunch before we go.
in good time
early enough, so that you do not have to rush, or so that you have time to get ready
Everything was ready for the party in good time.
on time
arriving somewhere or happening at the right time
The bus was on time.
The project was finished on time.
ahead of time
earlier than the time when you have arranged to do something or than when you need something
The building work was completed ahead of time.
Some of the food can be prepared ahead of time.
ahead of schedule
earlier than the officially agreed time
The prime minister called the elections early, five months ahead of schedule.
with time to spare
arriving somewhere or finishing something before the time when you have to arrive or finish
We got to the airport with plenty of time to spare.
I finished the test with time to spare.
first thing
immediately after you get up, or as soon as you start work
I’ll telephone her first thing tomorrow.
early.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: before the usual, arranged, or expected time
early.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They must have come home early.
early.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: near the beginning of a period of time, event, process etc
early.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The restaurant opened earlier this month.
We want to start as early as possible.
The disease is easy to treat if diagnosed early.
The building should be finished early next year.
She went out early in the morning.
He was sent off early in the game.
early.translation[1].note_box[0].section: Some of the guests arrived early.
I had to leave early, so I missed the end of the party.
Your father said he’d be home early.
Set the alarm for six – I have to be up early tomorrow.
I think I’ll go to bed early tonight.
We set off early in the morning.
I usually go on holiday early in July.
We moved to Manchester early in 2004.
It was too early in the year for a lot of flowers.
